definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: Astrologers today look to both planets to see what is coming up for you.
sentences.chinese: 如今占星师共同观察它们来预言你的未来。

sentences.english: We astrologers have known all about this for ages.
sentences.chinese: 我们占星师长期以来就知道与它有关的一切。

sentences.english: So the astronomers don't like astrologers.
sentences.chinese: 所以天文学家不喜欢占星师。

sentences.english: You don't have to be an astrologer to use this information.
sentences.chinese: 并非占星师才可以应用这些信息。

sentences.english: The astronomers believe one thing. The astrologers believe another.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家相信一件事，而占星师相信另一件。

sentences.english: The astronomers have declared war on the astrologers.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家已经向占星师宣战。

sentences.english: It is adding to the business for sweets manufacturers, priests and astrologers.
sentences.chinese: 就连糖果商，祭司和占星师也增添了业务量。

sentences.english: The astrologers, they feel, deserve it, purely by their very existence.
sentences.chinese: 占星师纯粹地觉得为了自身的存在值得接受挑战。

definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
Zi Wei Dou Shu, a form of Chinese fortune-telling
